Half Life - 10/10

This game was amazing, I purchased it in the bundle for $5, with all of the other Half Life games. This game is worth the money, even if it is not on sale. The current price as of 6/30/17 is only $0.99 so this game is worth the money all the way!

Pros- 
Very interesting story
Amazing level layout
Very nice graphics, for its age.

Cons-
Some enemies can be very challenging, especially if you have low health.
Sometimes the levels may get confusing.

Having been introduced to FPS games through Half-Life 2 when I was growing up, I imagined that its predecessor might also  provide another such welcome experience. Alas, it did not. It is not difficult to see what Half Life shares with its descendents, such  as the music, sound-effects, and the way levels change in terms of pace (Think Ravenholm from HL2 followed by the Antlions). But, the simple fact is, even playing on normal difficulty, I found myself getting gibbed more than I could count, and for no reason at all. Some levels were repetitive and quite tedious, to the point where I would either pull up a guide for help, or rework the entire level, something I cannot recall being forced to do in Half Life 2. The important thing is, Half Life isn't all bad, it's not; but it's flaws detract so much from it, that it makes the enjoyable points of the game much less enjoyable. God help whoever choses to play this+ Opposing Force+Blue Shift (Me). Overall Score: 7.5/10

Recomendadisimo,  habia escuchado muy buenas criticas de Half-Life y gracias a la compra de este pude corroborarlas en el presente. El sonido, trama y jugabilidad es envidiable a pesar del transcurso de 19 años de su estreno, te envolvera indudablemente. 10/10

Вкусы у людей могут сильно отличаться, и современным детям графика 98-го года может казаться смешной и убогой. Это можно понять, но всё же человеку, который не прошёл Half-Life, не стоит считать себя геймером. Эта игра - настолько признанная классика, что её надо внести в школьную программу по информатике. Как говорится, есть два типа людей: те, кто не доехал на поезде, и те, кто прошёл несколько раз.
Half Life cok gecmıs senelerde cıkan gonlumuzde taht kuran bır oyun sevıyoruz.

Reviewing Half-Life seems unnecessary, but a must.

As old as this game is now, those who have not played it probably will not enjoy it because games today are so different, both in graphics and in open-world areas, unlike Half-Life's linear narrative style.  My point being you probably already know by now if you like this game or not.

Half-Life was one of the first video games I ever played in 1998 and what got me into video games. I particularly liked the story and the immersiveness of story-telling through a game. It set a standard for games and how to tell stories through them ever since.

The story is one of the most unique of any game I have ever played and it has stuck with me all these years. One difference is your character never speaks, and this is a genius decision Valve made to allow you to feel more like the character. If the character did speak, it may be different from how you as the player would react in real life. Without speaking, you feel more immersed.

Half-Life set the way for Valve to become so successful and eventually create the Steam platform, and became a huge influence on all games and developers for years afterwards.

CLASSIC!
无需解释  神作  里程碑作品 今天看来依然很精细

A classic in every sense of the word, but unfortunatly: not timeless.  The game is quite linear, and you really do feel it despite the added puzzle elements.  Figuring out where to go next isn't a smooth process, which can be dull and frustrating at times. There isn't really room to stray in this game if you like side-quests, and most of the reward you get for that one hidden room is ammo.  

Voice acting and storytelling aged quite a bit, and you can thank the heavens for the long way we've come since then.  None of the characters are memorable, and I found myself annoyed by the multitude of monotone conversaions and the silent protagonist.  The game mechanics are also quite repetitive and you mostly find yourself jumping obstacles, shooting waves of enemies, and pressing buttons in order to make progress.  Playing this game in 2017 is like using a typewriter; it was quite an invention back in the day, but it will have to succumb to the passing of time eventually.  

One must not overlook that Half-Life has left an indelible mark on the FPS genre. If you're looking to back-track the roots of today's FPS games, I would recommend it for that sole purpose; otherwise, you're not missing out on the holy grail of what gaming has to offer today if you don't play it.

This game revolutionized the FPS genre. It was the first FPS game that really focused on story and not just on shooting demons or zombies. If you haven't played this then you should do it immediately.

Great game.

The story is medicore, largely moving from one area to the next because a scientist or security guard says either you have to go help with something or that's the next place to aim for to escape the alien infested facility. Pacing is good for the most part although there was two or three bits that seemed a bit too long for their own good, not bad though. Graphics have aged pretty well.

The gameplay makes up for the story easily enough to keep you going, controls are fast and responsive, there's a good variety of enemies and 15 weapons to gert throughout the game, I've heard some people complain that soldiers are too accurate and you just need to aaccept taking hits from them but I never had a problem with running to avoid most of their shots, there are occasional platforming parts that seem a bit dumb but you can quicksave at any point so it's not a big issue. Level design is brilliantly done to feel like a realistic environment as well as fun to play in.

Side notes I though of while I played: You're a Scientist gone Rambo, the military pulls some cheapshot stunts, 2001 Space Oddyssey

Ömrümü yedin ulan ömrümü. Üstüme atlayan küçük zibidiler olsun, gördüğü anda affetmeyen apache helikopteri olsun, revolver ile abanmama rağmen ölmeyen uçan yaratıklar olsun oyun sizi kanser edebilir. Ama Gordon Freeman'ın konuşamaması(ki bu o zamanın teknolojisine göre imkansız) veya hikayeyi anlatması gereken prof. amcaların çok sıkıcı olmasına rağmen hikaye başarılı bir şekilde anlatılıyor. Bilim kurgu veya fps sevenler için iyi bir seçim.

Grafik:3/10 (oyun 98 yapımı grafik için oynanan bir oyun değil zaten)
Hikaye:8/10
Oynayış:10/10

Now this might be just some unintresting review and I'm probaly going to get a lot of backlash for this but Half-Life is a great FPS game that was away ahead of it's time in 1998. I do belive Half-Life inspired such games as the Halo: Combat Evolved (Note: Please release Halo: CE and Halo 2 on Steam already...Thanks) and even the first Red Faction. If you are a newcomer to Steam or to the series in general like how I was, I would highly recommend picking this up on sale while you can and giving it a try.

Um jogo de 1998 ainda consegue ser tão bom quanto os jogos de hoje com uma história fantastica!
